intro: Tabernaemontana bouquetii, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is known for its showy, fragrant blooms that appear during the winter months. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
